You shake your head, backing out of the process. The rumbling ceases, and the light dies. It seems there are no penalties to starting over.

>>44316225

“I'd like my boots to allow me to walk across the air itself—if only, for the duration of a short sprint.”

> [[ Long ago, the earth and sky were one. ]]
> [[ Boundaries, then, were drawn by what we believed—not what we saw. ]]
> [[ Perhaps this would afford you the simplest possible taste of what that might be like. ]]
> [[ Deposit your boots, alongside three of our gifts, and we will grant you this power. ]]

>>44316542

“I would like to share the bounties of your gardens as medicine to help the ailing, and would like skilled caretakers to nurture the gardens.”

> [[ Yes; but caretakers can be afforded with mere coin. ]]
> [[ Only a truly blessed hand could see our ambrosia flourish and spread to the world below. ]]
> [[ We can provide caretakers most skilled—but you alone must play that role. ]]
> [[ If this is what you wish to become? Then return five of our gifts, and receive the power of Healing. ]]

>>44316455

> [[ Good—for War shan't spare his enemies. ]]
> [[ But will you use this gift as a coward, or as a hero? ]]
> [[ The power of this weapon is made known through the number of boons you are willing to return to us. ]]
> [[ Bring at least four, and we will make your desire manifest. ]]
